# Scale: Harmonic in G (Mode: Ionian Augmented, Shape: A)

---

## Brief Overview
The G Harmonic scale, also known as the Ionian Augmented mode in the key of G, is a unique scale that features an augmented 2nd interval. This scale has a distinct flavor due to this augmented 2nd, offering a rich and exotic sound that can be used to create interesting and colorful melodies.

---

## Notes and Intervals
The G Harmonic scale in the Ionian Augmented mode has the following notes and intervals:

- G (Root)
- A# (Augmented 2nd)
- B (Major 3rd)
- C# (Augmented 4th / Diminished 5th)
- D (Perfect 5th)
- E (Major 6th)
- F# (Major 7th)

This scale has a unique and intriguing sound due to the augmented 2nd interval (A#), which sets it apart from more traditional scales.

---

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The G Harmonic scale in the Ionian Augmented mode is not commonly used in mainstream music but can be found in genres that require a more exotic and adventurous sound. This scale can evoke feelings of mystery, tension, and suspense due to its unusual intervals and harmonic qualities.

Musicians and composers looking to add a touch of intrigue and drama to their compositions may find the G Harmonic scale in the Ionian Augmented mode to be a valuable tool in their creative arsenal.
